metadata.dc:author: Artiles Hernández, J L
del Rosario Medina, J
Chesa Ponce, N
Betancort de León, R
Ponce Socorro, J
metadata.dc:description: Urinary bilharziasis is a parasitic disease caused by Schistosome haematobium which is prevalent in several African and Middle East countries. The closeness of the Canary Islands to the African continent and a greater population mobility have allowed us to diagnose and treat ten patients, all of them natural of this region. This paper outlines the case-reports, and reviews this parasitic disease which seriously affects the urinary tract and which must be specifically contemplated both in emigrants and occasional visitors from endemic regions.
metadata.dc:title: Bilharziosis urinaria. Comentarios sobre 10 casos.
[Urinary bilharziasis. Comments on 10 cases].
